action.action-desc: Mr. Sires (for himself and Mr. Young of Iowa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Peace Corps Act to allow former volunteers and officers and employees to use the seal, emblem, or name of Peace Corps on death announcements and grave stones.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Respect for Peace Corps Volunteers Act.

section.header: Use of official seal, emblem, and name of the Peace Corps
section.text: Subsection (b) of section 19 of the Peace Corps Act (22 U.S.C. 2518) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting before the period at the end the following: , except that the official seal or emblem and the name Peace Corps may be used on any death announcement, gravestone, plaque, or other grave marker of any person who served as a volunteer or as an officer or employee of the Peace Corps under such rules as may be prescribed by the Director; and
in paragraph (2), in the first sentence, by inserting or in accordance with the exception specified in paragraph (1), before shall be fined.
